Travel Time.quote: It's a 3-hour drive each way to the clinic. By the time we get there and back, the whole day is shot.
Travel Time.persona_descriptor: Rural Working Mother, 34, lives 180 miles from study site

Travel Time.quote: The gas money alone is killing us. We're spending more on travel than we expected when we signed up.
I have to leave work early just to make the appointment time, and that's if traffic cooperates.
My daughter gets carsick on long drives, so she's already stressed before we even get to the clinic.

Multiple Children at Home.quote: Finding someone to watch my other two kids during appointments is a nightmare. My usual babysitter isn't always available.
Multiple Children at Home.persona_descriptor: Stay-at-home Mother, 36, three children ages 8, 12, and 15

Multiple Children at Home.quote: My 6-year-old doesn't understand why his sister gets to leave school for 'adventures' while he has to stay.
I feel guilty leaving my youngest with grandma so often. She's 82 and it's a lot to ask.
Multiple Children at Home.persona_descriptor: Single Mother, 33, relies on extended family

Multiple Children at Home.quote: The other kids are starting to resent all the attention their sibling gets. It's affecting our whole family dynamic.
Coordinating three different school schedules plus appointments is like running a small business.

School Disruption.quote: She's missing so much school that her grades are starting to slip. Her teachers are understanding, but she's falling behind.
The other kids ask why he gets to skip school so much. It's hard to explain without making it sound fun.
We're constantly doing makeup work and trying to catch up. It feels like we're always one step behind.
The school nurse has to coordinate with the study team, and sometimes communication gets mixed up.
School Disruption.persona_descriptor: Advocate Parent, 46, deals with school administration

Childcare Arrangements.quote: Daycare charges me even when my daughter isn't there for appointments. I'm paying double some days.
My mom can watch the kids, but she lives an hour away and doesn't drive anymore.
Finding a babysitter who can handle my son's medical needs while I'm gone with his sister is nearly impossible.
Childcare Arrangements.persona_descriptor: Special Needs Parent, 41, multiple children with health issues

Childcare Arrangements.quote: The neighbor who usually helps had to stop because her own schedule changed. Now I'm scrambling.

Lost Wages.quote: I'm burning through my sick days and vacation time. After that, it's unpaid leave and we can't afford it.
My boss is getting frustrated with all the time off requests. I'm worried about my job security.
We had to cancel our family vacation because I used all my PTO for study visits.
The unpaid hours are adding up. We're behind on bills and it's stressing our marriage.

Emotional Fatigue.quote: I'm emotionally drained. Every appointment brings new anxiety about what they might find.
Emotional Fatigue.persona_descriptor: Anxious Caregiver, 37, first-time dealing with medical studies

Emotional Fatigue.quote: I have to be strong for my daughter, but sometimes I just want to break down and cry.
The constant worry about whether we're doing the right thing keeps me up at night.
I feel like I'm failing as a parent when I see how stressed these appointments make my child.
Emotional Fatigue.persona_descriptor: Self-critical Mother, 39, high expectations for herself

Emotional Fatigue.quote: The emotional rollercoaster of hope and fear is exhausting. Some days I don't know how to keep going.

Procedure Discomfort.quote: The blood draws hurt more than they said they would. I dread going back.
My arm is always sore for days after. It affects my basketball practice.
They stick me multiple times sometimes because my veins are hard to find. It's awful.
The ECG patches irritate my skin and leave marks. People at school ask what happened.

Needle Fear.quote: I've been afraid of needles since I was little. Even thinking about the appointment makes me panic.
Needle Fear.persona_descriptor: Phobic Teen, 14, childhood trauma with medical procedures

Needle Fear.quote: I can't watch when they do the blood draw. I get dizzy and feel like I'm going to pass out.
Needle Fear.persona_descriptor: Vasovagal Teen, 17, physiological response to needles

Needle Fear.quote: My friends don't understand why I'm so scared. They think I'm being a baby.
I tried to quit the study because of the needles, but my parents convinced me to stay.
Needle Fear.persona_descriptor: Reluctant Teen, 15, family pressure to continue

Missed School.quote: I'm missing my favorite classes and falling behind in AP Biology. It's stressing me out.
My friends are hanging out without me because I'm always at appointments. I feel left out.
I had to quit the drama club because I keep missing rehearsals for study visits.
The teachers are understanding, but making up tests and assignments is overwhelming.

Visit Frequency.quote: It feels like we just got home and we're already planning the next trip. There's no break.
Every week there's something. I can't plan anything because of all these appointments.
Visit Frequency.persona_descriptor: Frustrated Parent, 41, values routine and predictability

Visit Frequency.quote: My work schedule is completely disrupted. I feel like I'm always asking for time off.
The frequency is overwhelming. I didn't realize how much it would take over our lives.
Visit Frequency.persona_descriptor: Unprepared Parent, 33, didn't fully understand commitment

Child Anxiety.quote: She starts crying the night before appointments. She knows what's coming and she's terrified.
He has nightmares about the procedures. I don't know how to help him cope.
Child Anxiety.persona_descriptor: Concerned Father, 44, child experiencing PTSD symptoms

Child Anxiety.quote: She refuses to get in the car on appointment days. We have to physically carry her sometimes.
My daughter asks if she did something wrong to deserve this. It breaks my heart.

Invasive Tests.quote: The biopsy was way worse than I expected. They said it would be 'uncomfortable' but it was agony.
Having strangers examine my body makes me feel violated, even though I know it's medical.
I feel like a lab rat sometimes. Poke this, test that, examine here. I'm not a person to them.

Time Away from Family.quote: I'm missing my other kids' soccer games and school events. They're growing up without me there.
Time Away from Family.persona_descriptor: Guilty Mother, 40, trying to balance multiple children's needs

Time Away from Family.quote: My husband is doing everything at home while I'm at appointments. It's not fair to him.
Time Away from Family.persona_descriptor: Concerned Wife, 37, worried about marriage strain

Time Away from Family.quote: We never have family time anymore. Everything revolves around these appointments.
I feel like I'm neglecting my elderly parents who also need care and attention.
Time Away from Family.persona_descriptor: Sandwich Generation Mother, 46, caring for multiple generations
